result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall G. Buckingham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia (Forfeiture). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

3:58 p.m. Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in court. Calling 15cm353, 18fo521, 16fo985. Defendant states he has cancer and lost his job; he did make payment today. Adj. 3:59 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for February 11, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

3:40 p.m. Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in court, in custody via video.  Calling 15cm353, 18fo521 and 16fo985. Court notes record. Defendant states he is in custody on warrant for new ticket that he was not aware of. Has been in custody for almost a week - Can make $100 or $200 payment if can be released - is a personal gardener - Starts full-time employment with McDonalds, Rhinelander, on Wednesday. Court expects significant payments by next review hearing. Adj. 3:43 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 10, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

3:48 p.m. Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in court. Calling 15cm353 and 16fo985. Defendant states he cannot explain but now only has $50 with him; states apparently counted money incorrectly. Court changes review date and defendant needs to make $50 payment immediately to Clerk of Court. Adj. 3:51 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 11, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

3:32 p.m. Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in court.  Calling 15cm353 and 16fo985. Defendant states he brought $100 today. Defendant must make $100 payment in Clerk of Court's office today. Adj. 3:35 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for August 13, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

1:45 p.m. Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in court, in custody via video.  Calling 15cm353 and 16fo985. Court recites record. Defendant states he was working on Monday at time of review hearing. Has not made any payments because house has been condemned and he has to move. He is capable of making payments just cannot make them right now. Was unemployed from November through March. April 23, 2018 house is going to be demolished. Defendant is willing to return to jail to sit time out but needs to be released to remove his personal property before house is demolished. Court will allow release today with review hearing scheduled for Monday, April 23, 2018. Defendant to return to court with payment, game plan for payment or will return to jail. Court quashes warrants. Adj. 1:51 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for April 23, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
